intro: Aquilegia nemoralis, commonly known as the common columbine, is a herbaceous perennial native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its striking, spurred flowers that come in shades of blue, purple, and white. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring compound leaves with lobes that are often notched or toothed. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Aquilegia nemoralis prefers moist, well-drained soils and can thrive in partial to full shade.
